verses.verse: And there was a famine<WH7458> in the land<WH776>, beside<WH905> the first<WH7223> famine<WH7458> that was in the days<WH3117> of Abraham<WH85>. And Isaac<WH3327> went<WH3212> unto Abimelech<WH40> king<WH4428> of the Philistines<WH6430> unto Gerar<WH1642>.
And the LORD<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> unto him, and said<WH559>, Go not down<WH3381> into Egypt<WH4714>; dwell<WH7931> in the land<WH776> which I shall tell<WH559> thee of:

Sojourn<WH1481> in this land<WH776>, and I will be with thee, and will bless<WH1288> thee; for unto thee, and unto thy seed<WH2233>, I will give<WH5414> all these<WH411> countries<WH776>, and I will perform<WH6965> the oath<WH7621> which I sware<WH7650> unto Abraham<WH85> thy father<WH1>;

And I will make<WH7235> thy seed<WH2233> to multiply<WH7235> as the stars<WH3556> of heaven<WH8064>, and will give<WH5414> unto thy seed<WH2233> all these<WH411> countries<WH776>; and in thy seed<WH2233> shall all the nations<WH1471> of the earth<WH776> be blessed<WH1288>;
Because<WH6118> that Abraham<WH85> obeyed<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>, and kept<WH8104> my charge<WH4931>, my commandments<WH4687>, my statutes<WH2708>, and my laws<WH8451>.
And Isaac<WH3327> dwelt<WH3427> in Gerar<WH1642>:

And the men<WH582> of the place<WH4725> asked<WH7592> him of his wife<WH802>; and he said<WH559>, She is my sister<WH269>: for he feared<WH3372> to say<WH559>, She is my wife<WH802>; lest, said he, the men<WH582> of the place<WH4725> should kill<WH2026> me for Rebekah<WH7259>; because she was fair<WH2896> to look upon<WH4758>.

And it came to pass, when he had been there a long<WH748> time<WH3117>, that Abimelech<WH40> king<WH4428> of the Philistines<WH6430> looked out<WH8259> at<WH1157> a window<WH2474>, and saw<WH7200>, and, behold, Isaac<WH3327> was sporting<WH6711> with Rebekah<WH7259> his wife<WH802>.

And Abimelech<WH40> called<WH7121> Isaac<WH3327>, and said<WH559>, Behold, of a surety<WH389> she is thy wife<WH802>: and how saidst<WH559> thou, She is my sister<WH269>? And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto him, Because I said<WH559>, Lest I die<WH4191> for her.

And Abimelech<WH40> said<WH559>, What is this thou hast done<WH6213> unto us? one<WH259> of the people<WH5971> might lightly<WH4592> have lien<WH7901> with thy wife<WH802>, and thou shouldest have brought<WH935> guiltiness<WH817> upon us.
And Abimelech<WH40> charged<WH6680> all his people<WH5971>, saying<WH559>, He that toucheth<WH5060> this man<WH376> or his wife<WH802> shall surely<WH4191> be put to death<WH4191>.
Then Isaac<WH3327> sowed<WH2232> in that land<WH776>, and received<WH4672> in the same year<WH8141> an hundredfold<WH3967> <WH8180>: and the LORD<WH3068> blessed<WH1288> him. received: Heb. found
And the man<WH376> waxed great<WH1431>, and went<WH3212> forward<WH1980>, and grew<WH1432> until he became<WH1431> very<WH3966> great<WH1431>: went: Heb. went going

For he had possession<WH4735> of flocks<WH6629>, and possession<WH4735> of herds<WH1241>, and great store<WH7227> of servants<WH5657>: and the Philistines<WH6430> envied<WH7065> him. servants: or, husbandry

For all the wells<WH875> which his father's<WH1> servants<WH5650> had digged<WH2658> in the days<WH3117> of Abraham<WH85> his father<WH1>, the Philistines<WH6430> had stopped<WH5640> them, and filled<WH4390> them with earth<WH6083>.
And Abimelech<WH40> said<WH559> unto Isaac<WH3327>, Go<WH3212> from us; for thou art much<WH3966> mightier<WH6105> than we.
And Isaac<WH3327> departed<WH3212> thence, and pitched his tent<WH2583> in the valley<WH5158> of Gerar<WH1642>, and dwelt<WH3427> there<WH8033>.

And Isaac<WH3327> digged<WH2658> again<WH7725> the wells<WH875> of water<WH4325>, which they had digged<WH2658> in the days<WH3117> of Abraham<WH85> his father<WH1>; for the Philistines<WH6430> had stopped<WH5640> them after<WH310> the death<WH4194> of Abraham<WH85>: and he called<WH7121> their names<WH8034> after the names<WH8034> by which<WH834> his father<WH1> had called<WH7121> them.
And Isaac's<WH3327> servants<WH5650> digged<WH2658> in the valley<WH5158>, and found<WH4672> there a well<WH875> of springing<WH2416> water<WH4325>. springing: Heb. living

And the herdmen<WH7462> of Gerar<WH1642> did strive<WH7378> with Isaac's<WH3327> herdmen<WH7462>, saying<WH559>, The water<WH4325> is ours: and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the well<WH875> Esek<WH6230>; because they strove<WH6229> with him. Esek: that is, Contention
And they digged<WH2658> another<WH312> well<WH875>, and strove<WH7378> for that also: and he called<WH7121> the name of it<WH8034> Sitnah<WH7856>. Sitnah: that is, Hatred

And he removed<WH6275> from thence, and digged<WH2658> another<WH312> well<WH875>; and for that they strove<WH7378> not: and he called<WH7121> the name of it<WH8034> Rehoboth<WH7344>; and he said<WH559>, For now<WH6258> the LORD<WH3068> hath made room<WH7337> for us, and we shall be fruitful<WH6509> in the land<WH776>. Rehoboth: that is Room
And he went up<WH5927> from thence to Beersheba<WH884>.

And the LORD<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> unto him the same night<WH3915>, and said<WH559>, I am the God<WH430> of Abraham<WH85> thy father<WH1>: fear<WH3372> not, for I am with<WH854> thee, and will bless<WH1288> thee, and multiply<WH7235> thy seed<WH2233> for my servant<WH5650> Abraham's<WH85> sake.

And he builded<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> there, and called<WH7121> upon the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068>, and pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168> there: and there Isaac's<WH3327> servants<WH5650> digged<WH3738> a well<WH875>.
Then Abimelech<WH40> went<WH1980> to him from Gerar<WH1642>, and Ahuzzath<WH276> one of his friends<WH4828>, and Phichol<WH6369> the chief captain<WH8269> of his army<WH6635>.
And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto them, Wherefore<WH4069> come<WH935> ye to me, seeing ye hate<WH8130> me, and have sent me away<WH7971> from you?

And they said<WH559>, We saw<WH7200> certainly<WH7200> that the LORD<WH3068> was with thee: and we said<WH559>, Let there be now an oath<WH423> betwixt<WH996> us, even betwixt<WH996> us and thee, and let us make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with thee; We saw: Heb. Seeing we saw

That thou wilt do<WH6213> us no hurt<WH7451>, as we have not touched<WH5060> thee, and as we have done<WH6213> unto thee nothing but<WH7535> good<WH2896>, and have sent thee away<WH7971> in peace<WH7965>: thou art now<WH6258> the blessed<WH1288> of the LORD<WH3068>. That: Heb. If thou shalt
And he made<WH6213> them a feast<WH4960>, and they did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>.
And they rose up betimes<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and sware<WH7650> one<WH376> to another<WH251>: and Isaac<WH3327> sent them away<WH7971>, and they departed<WH3212> from him in peace<WH7965>.

And it came to pass the same day<WH3117>, that Isaac's<WH3327> servants<WH5650> came<WH935>, and told<WH5046> him concerning<WH182> the well<WH875> which they had digged<WH2658>, and said<WH559> unto him, We have found<WH4672> water<WH4325>.
And he called<WH7121> it Shebah<WH7656>: therefore the name<WH8034> of the city<WH5892> is Beersheba<WH884> unto this day<WH3117>. Shebah: That is, an oath Beersheba: that is, the well of the oath

And Esau<WH6215> was forty<WH705> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> when he took<WH3947> to wife<WH802> Judith<WH3067> the daughter<WH1323> of Beeri<WH882> the Hittite<WH2850>, and Bashemath<WH1315> the daughter<WH1323> of Elon<WH356> the Hittite<WH2850>:
Which were a grief<WH4786> of mind<WH7307> unto Isaac<WH3327> and to Rebekah<WH7259>. a grief: Heb. bitterness of spirit
